intro: Lepidosperma laeve, commonly known as the smooth sedgeland, is a perennial grass-like plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Lepidosperma laeve plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
